short_description: My personal space to showcase my projects, highlight my full-stack skills, and share a bit about myself.

technologies.name: Angular
technologies.info: I built dynamic single-page applications, using components, services, and reactive forms to manage complex frontend behavior.

technologies.name: TypeScript
technologies.info: I used TypeScript to write more maintainable, strongly typed JavaScript code, improving the reliability and scalability of applications.

short_description: Native Android game inspired by the classic Minesweeper, featuring multiple difficulty levels, real-time leaderboard, and Firebase-based user management.
description: BuscaMinEs is a native Android application that recreates the classic Minesweeper game while extending its functionality with modern mobile features. The app includes multiple difficulty levels, persistent game state, and an online leaderboard that allows users to compete and compare scores. The project focuses on clean architecture, responsive UI design, and the integration of cloud services for authentication and data storage.

technologies.name: Kotlin
technologies.info: Used as the primary programming language to develop a native Android application. This project demonstrates the use of Kotlin for UI interaction, game logic implementation, state management, and asynchronous operations following Android best practices.

technologies.name: Android SDK
technologies.info: The Android SDK was used to build the application structure, manage activities and layouts, handle user input, and ensure compatibility across different Android devices and screen sizes.

technologies.name: Firebase
technologies.info: Firebase was integrated to provide user authentication, real-time database functionality, and cloud-based data synchronization. It enables features such as online leaderboards and persistent user data across sessions.

short_description: A mobile app designed for music lovers, allowing you to browse and purchase your favorite vinyl records.

technologies.name: Java
technologies.info: I developed object-oriented applications, understanding core principles like inheritance, polymorphism, and modular architecture.

technologies.name: MySQL
technologies.info: I designed relational schemas, wrote complex SQL queries, and ensured data integrity with foreign keys and constraints.

short_description: This Lab-Stock web app streamlines the management of laboratory inventory for my former high school, ensuring efficient tracking and organization of supplies.

technologies.name: Laravel

technologies.name: PHP

technologies.name: Python

short_description: Zumzeig is an Android app designed for a local cinema in Barcelona, enhancing the movie-going experience with seamless access to schedules and information.
description:
This application was my final project for my higher degree. My classmate and I wanted to support and promote local cinema, recognizing its cultural significance beyond the dominance of large film industries. To achieve this, we collaborated with a local cinema in Barcelona and developed a fully customized Android application tailored to their needs.

The app was built using Android Studio with Kotlin as the primary programming language, and it integrates a MySQL relational database to store and manage user information efficiently. One of the main goals was to enhance user engagement by allowing them to create personalized profiles, where they can save their favorite events, delete events, update personal information, and change their passwords.

Additionally, the app provides essential features for cinema-goers, such as checking movie schedules and exploring the history of the cinema, giving users deeper insight into the venue’s background and its cultural impact.

To improve security and user experience, I implemented OTP-based password recovery using PHPmailer, ensuring that users can securely reset their passwords if needed. The overall design and functionality of the app were carefully crafted to provide a smooth and intuitive experience, making it easier for the cinema’s audience to stay connected and engaged with their favorite local film screenings.

technologies.name: Kotlin
technologies.info: I learned to develop native Android applications, focusing on UI design, data persistence, and asynchronous programming.

technologies.name: Git
technologies.info: I gained experience with version control, working collaboratively using branches, merges, and managing code history through GitHub.
